issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
In KitchenSink-Nook on the Kindle Fire, Facebook > Photos, when "Upload Photo from Gallery with Graph API" is click and the photo is selected, it is never uploaded to the Facebook page. There is no loading indicator, no success message, no error message.

The photo uploads correctly on all other tested Android devices (using regular KitchenSink where valid).

However, "Upload Photo from file with REST API" does work.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Run KitchenSink-Nook on the Kindle Fire.
2. Run Mashups > Facebook > Photos, login to Facebook as needed.
3. Click "Upload Photo from Gallery with Graph API" and select a photo.

Expected Result:

Photo should upload, there should be a success message, and the photo should be visible on the user's Facebook page.

Actual Result:

The photo gallery correctly closes and the app redisplays, but nothing else happens at all.
fields.summary: Android: KS-Nook: Kindle Fire: Mashups > Facebook > Photos > Upload Photo from Gallery with Graph API fails
fields.environment:
SDK: 1.8.1, 1.8.2, 2.0.0.GA, 2.0.1.v20120410131722
Android: V8, Rhino
Studio: 2.0.1.201204101854
OS: Snow Leopard
Devices Tested: Nook Color 1.4.2, Kindle Fire 6.3, Amaze 2.3.4, Nexus One 2.2.2, Xoom 4.0.2
Devices Affected: Kindle Fire 6.3

comments.body: Resolving ticket as invalid as this version of Kitchen Sink is no longer supported.
